condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted provinces, communities, families, girls and boys have the authority, capacity and motivation to protect themselves against early marriage and FGM/C

description.narrative: The strategic involvement of community and religious leaders in community mobilization and awareness-raising yielded results in 2019 in two provinces, where 34 communities publicly declared the abandonment of harmful practices, including child marriage and female genital mutilation. Community radio has proven effective at reaching a greater number of community members with key messages. Preliminary findings of the evaluation of the implementation of the programmatic framework to end child marriage and female genital mutilation indicate that a multi-pronged approach that goes beyond community mobilization is required to end harmful practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
Communities that have participated in a public declaration of support for the abandonment of FGM/C
